Probably a good place for drinking, but the food was just okay.  Not that big/filling and didn't hit my tastebuds right.  Not sure what didn't jive with me on it, I just wasn't impressed.  Maybe I need to be drunk next time.

Went to Mortimer's first time the other day. The beer selection was good, but the food was mediocre for the prices. The nacho appetizer was dry - it had jalape√±os, lettuce, and beans on top but no cheese, salsa, or guacamole. Potato soup was okay. The sandwich (beef on weck) was pretty good. Overall okay food but nothing great. If I come back it would be for drinks at the bar.

I was here for the evening (tagging along on a work trip) and wanted a fast meal (not fast food) with a beer and looking for something chill.   Sat at the bar (by myself) and the bartenders were really attentive, had an awesome Antipasto Salad, and a beer. My meal was very good and the menu looked appetizing with lots of options.  It was a somewhat noisy bar, but that is expected given the crowd, the multiple TV screens and vibe of this place. I would come back with friends and also eat here again. All in all I couldn't have asked for more that evening.

Located in the Epicenter near the convention center, we ate here most days after the show.   Good selection of wraps and paninis  Jamacian Jerk Wrap is tasty Grilled cheese bites app is awesome Pretzel bites app is epic

The rents were in town this weekend, and after giving them a tour of Charlotte we were getting a bit famished. My father is a picky eater, so when I saw Mortimer's Menu is made up of tons of fresh sandwiches, I knew it would be a safe bet to grab some lunch. Mortimer's didn't only impress the rents but it also made me quite the happy camper.  Located in the Epicenter, Mortimer's looks like a sports bar/ pub, but the menu is that of a high-end cafe/ deli. There were a few outdoor tables, but we decided to eat inside to escape the heat for a bit. There are some half booths and high top tables (as well as the bar), and we were greeted and seated at one of the high tops. Unlike other bar-esque restaurants I've eaten in, these high top chairs were not only easily accessible but were also surprisingly comfy. After ordering drinks we took in the ambiance of the place which consisted of TVs and silly pro-booze signs and quotes along the wall.  As I already mentioned, the menu is more extensive than I expected. There are tons of different sandwiches ranging from simple cold cuts to grilled chicken. There were regular sandwiches, wraps and paninis, as well as some salads to help round out the menu. The prices ranged from $8-10 per sandwich which isn't too shabby for the high-quality sandwich and side you get.  I went with the Roast Beef on Weck, which is kind of like a French Dip roast beef sandwich but on a special caraway seed bun instead of the hoagie roll. The roast beef was pretty high quality and came on the bun all warmed up from a hot bath in au jus. The sandwich also came with a generous portion of au jus for dipping, and the container was actually large enough to accommodate the sandwich. The au jus was divine and really made the sandwich...it was full of rich, beefy goodness. The caraway seed bread was sopped up the au jus perfectly and made for an all around great sandwich. I got the fruit salad as a side and it was a large portion of  FRESH cantaloupe, honey dew, pineapple and strawberries. All in all, it was a great lunch.  The miss' had the Presto Chicken Pesto which had grilled chicken with roasted peppers and pesto. Now I didn't think I liked pesto, but I did try a dollop of hers, and then went ahead and stole a few other tastes. It was pretty darn tasty, and now I'm bugging her to make some fresh pesto so I can get the full pasta experience. My mom had the Veggie Pita which was just a bunch of veggies in a pita.I need some meat with my meal so this wasn't my cup of tea, but my mom was pretty happy.   My dad, being his boring self, went with the "Your Grinder", which is just a "make your own plain sandwich." He got turkey, added some veggies and mayo and that was it. I shook my head in disappointment as he had this incredibly diverse menu of gourmet sammies to choose from and he went with the most basic of all. Still, he was raving about his sandwich in the end so more power to him and his bland  palate I suppose.   The sandwiches were all really good, the menu was extensive, the staff was friendly and the prices were down-right affordable for the quality. I don't know how it would be on a busy weekend night, but for a quick and tasty lunch downtown, it's the way to go. If it's lunch time and I'm in the area with a hankering for some meat on bread, this is the place I'd go. It's definitely my favorite sandwich joint  down here so far.
This was my first time here.  The food was yummy, the service was great and fast!  Great drink selections!!!!

Fairly crowded on arrival. Live sports radio broadcast event.  Was seated in area near bar and told could order from bartender. Others that came in after us managed to get tables and wait staff.  Surprisingly bartenders never offered any service.  Eventually we found a menu on our own and wrote down our order and carried it to whom I guess was the manager on duty. Food came out promptly.  I had the Big Diaw (Roast Beef and Swiss Panini) with kettle chips. I enjoyed the sandwich, Cajun mayonnaise had a bit more spice than expected. Kettle chips tasted as if they came from a bag rather than freshly prepared as expected.  Other members of my party had the Philly Cheesesteak also with kettle chips (they made the same comment) and Nachos. The nachos were larger than expected.  I'm not sure I would go back with so many other choices in the area.

Stopped in for lunch while visiting Charlotte, fresh from the airport and checked into the aLoft.  The atmosphere is a traditional pub setting, and they play lots of loud 80's music.  Luckily, I happen to like 80's music!  I had the French Dip sandwich (can't remember the exact name of it).  I can honestly say that it was probably the best French Dip I have ever had.  The bread was good, the beef was rare, and the au jus had just a hint of spiciness to it.  The sandwich was served with kettle chips, but you have your choice of other sides like potato salad as well.  Very good lunch, nothing too fancy, just right!

Beware deceptive pricing on liquor offerings.  Standard brands are listed along with booze that costs $35 for a shot and there are no prices listed.  Bartenders seemed to have rather been at the dentist
Best non-epicenteresque bar in the epicenter. Great food for a bar, the pretzel and mac and cheese bites FTW. Good service and a nice patio.

Ordered takeout for dinner during a late night at the office. They have an expansive sandwich/wrap/panini menu with Boar's Head meats (which I love). I ordered the Hawaiian Chicken panini because I'll eat anything with pineapple on it (well, almost anything).  The panini was good but nothing to write home about. Then again, the whole idea of writing home is pretty antiquated...but I digress. Anyway, the pineapple was ample and the cheese was generous as well. However, there could've been a little more meat.  The panini comes with one side and I ordered the mac salad. It was pretty small and very underwhelming. Small as it was, I didn't even bother finishing it.  I would give the panini four stars and the mac salad only two, for an average of three. Seems like a better spot for lunch than dinner.

Visiting Charlotte for the first time and had a blast here...server was awesome and had plenty of info on the night life here! Food was typical bar and pub style but good nonetheless. But great people with a nice cold beer!

Me, Ben & James stopped in on Friday during the Coca Cola 600 weekend. They shut down all of Uptown to celebrate those left hand turns over at Charlotte Motor Speedway.  We were looking for a place to sit outside and enjoy the weather but every place was full. The last place we tried was here and we decided to go inside and wait for an outside table.  We were served by Aaron from Lenoir, an Air Force Veteran who has worked there for several years. A friendly fellow though he admitted his allegiance to the Redskins.  He noticed my hat and being Memorial Weekend, invited me to sign their Veteran wall.  We decided to forget about the outside table and talked Panther and Redskin football with Aaron instead.

Service is a bit slow, but the pretzel bites are outstanding. I like coming here when all the other Epicenter locations are too crowded, or listen to their live music (always an acoustic jammy feel). Overall it has a great "off the path" pub feel while still being at the heart of uptown Charlotte. Come early if you want a seat for Happy hour!
